author: vexx32
body:
<!-- Anything that looks like this is a comment and can't be seen after the Pull Request is created. -->

# PR Summary

Code cleanup for `Parser.Tests.ps1`

Removed: 1 test (it was not working as intended and was based on a flawed premise).

## PR Context

Cleanup PR in preparation for another PR.

## PR Checklist

- [x] [PR has a meaningful title](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---submission)
    - Use the present tense and imperative mood when describing your changes
- [x] [Summarized changes](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---submission)
- [x] [Make sure all `.h`, `.cpp`, `.cs`, `.ps1` and `.psm1` files have the correct copyright header](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---submission)
- [x] This PR is ready to merge and is not [Work in Progress](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---work-in-progress).
    - If the PR is work in progress, please add the prefix `WIP:` or `[ WIP ]` to the beginning of the title (the `WIP` bot will keep its status check at `Pending` while the prefix is present) and remove the prefix when the PR is ready.
- **[Breaking changes](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#making-breaking-changes)**
    - [x] None
    - **OR**
    - [ ] [Experimental feature(s) needed](https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/PowerShell-Docs/blob/staging/reference/6/Microsoft.PowerShell.Core/About/about_Experimental_Features.md)
        - [ ] Experimental feature name(s): <!-- Experimental feature name(s) here -->
- **User-facing changes**
    - [x] Not Applicable
    - **OR**
    - [ ] [Documentation needed](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---submission)
        - [ ] Issue filed: <!-- Number/link of that issue here -->
- **Testing - New and feature**
    - [x] N/A or can only be tested interactively
    - **OR**
    - [ ] [Make sure you've added a new test if existing tests do not effectively test the code changed](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#before-submitting)

comments.author: PoshChan
comments.body:
@vexx32, your last commit had 8 failures in `PowerShell-CI-macos`
(These are 5 of the failures)

ParserTests (admin\monad\tests\monad\src\engine\core\ParserTests.cs).This test will check that a path is correctly interpreted when using '..' and '.'  (line 364)
```powershell
Expected 2, but got 0.
at <ScriptBlock>, /Users/vsts/agent/2.150.3/work/1/s/test/powershell/Language/Parser/Parser.Tests.ps1: line 190
190:         $result.Count | Should -Be 2
```
ParserTests (admin\monad\tests\monad\src\engine\core\ParserTests.cs).This test will check that the parser can handle a mix of forward slashes and back slashes in the path (line 417)
```powershell
Expected 2, but got 0.
at <ScriptBlock>, /Users/vsts/agent/2.150.3/work/1/s/test/powershell/Language/Parser/Parser.Tests.ps1: line 197
197:         $result.Count | Should -Be 2
```
ParserTests (admin\monad\tests\monad\src\engine\core\ParserTests.cs).This test checks that the asterisk globs as expected. (line 545)
```powershell
Expected 2, but got 0.
at <ScriptBlock>, /Users/vsts/agent/2.150.3/work/1/s/test/powershell/Language/Parser/Parser.Tests.ps1: line 204
204:         $result.Count | Should -Be 2
```
ParserTests (admin\monad\tests\monad\src\engine\core\ParserTests.cs).This test checks that we can use a range for globbing: [1-2] (line 557)
```powershell
Expected 2, but got 0.
at <ScriptBlock>, /Users/vsts/agent/2.150.3/work/1/s/test/powershell/Language/Parser/Parser.Tests.ps1: line 211
211:         $result.Count | Should -Be 2
```
ParserTests (admin\monad\tests\monad\src\engine\core\ParserTests.cs).Test that & can be used as a parameter as long as it is quoted. (line 1606)
```powershell
Expected strings to be the same, but they were different.
Expected length: 26
Actual length:   28
Strings differ at index 15.
Expected: '&Get-ChildItem;unset;unset'
But was:  '&Get-ChildItem; unset; unset'
at <ScriptBlock>, /Users/vsts/agent/2.150.3/work/1/s/test/powershell/Language/Parser/Parser.Tests.ps1: line 681
681:         $result | Should -Be "&Get-ChildItem;unset;unset"
```

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body: C'est la vie. Soon as you try to clean up old code, you miss something. 😄

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body: @iSazonov I'll look to split out some of the commits to separate PRs. 👍

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @vexx32 Thanks! Tests is sometimes very sensitive (especially in _parser_ tests where even spaces can be important) and we should not change them without much need.

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body:
I don't disagree, but if the parser can't handle spaces we've got some issues anyway 😉 

The parser tests are a bit sensitive, indeed, but I don't think that should mean we have _all_ test cases without spaces. Maybe one or two cases to verify that those modes work, but the rest should be relatively clear as to their intent in my opinion.

comments.author: PoshChan
comments.body:
@vexx32, your last commit had 3 failures in `PowerShell-CI-macos`
ParserTests (admin\monad\tests\monad\src\engine\core\ParserTests.cs).Test that & can be used as a parameter as long as it is quoted. (line 1606)
```powershell
Expected strings to be the same, but they were different.
Expected length: 28
Actual length:   26
Strings differ at index 15.
Expected: '&Get-ChildItem; unset; unset'
But was:  '&Get-ChildItem;unset;unset'
at <ScriptBlock>, /Users/vsts/agent/2.150.3/work/1/s/test/powershell/Language/Parser/Parser.Tests.ps1: line 674
674:         $result | Should -Be "&Get-ChildItem; unset; unset"
```
ParserTests (admin\monad\tests\monad\src\engine\core\ParserTests.cs).Run a command with parameters. (line 1621)
```powershell
Expected strings to be the same, but they were different.
Expected length: 17
Actual length:   15
Strings differ at index 4.
Expected: 'set; unset; unset'
But was:  'set;unset;unset'
at <ScriptBlock>, /Users/vsts/agent/2.150.3/work/1/s/test/powershell/Language/Parser/Parser.Tests.ps1: line 681
681:         $result | Should -Be "set; unset; unset"
```
ParserTests (admin\monad\tests\monad\src\engine\core\ParserTests.cs).Test that an alias is resolved before a function. (line 1657)
```powershell
Expected strings to be the same, but they were different.
Expected length: 19
Actual length:   17
Strings differ at index 6.
Expected: 'unset; unset; unset'
But was:  'unset;unset;unset'
at <ScriptBlock>, /Users/vsts/agent/2.150.3/work/1/s/test/powershell/Language/Parser/Parser.Tests.ps1: line 698
698:         $result | Should -Be "unset; unset; unset"
```

Do you think it's worthwhile to further split the PR?

comments.body: @vexx32 	Rebased your branch to make sure we have current test results.

title: Cleanup Parser tests
